summary: TL*THE CONTACT OWNS A 2007 LARK CARGO TRAILER (NA).  THE CONTACT NOTICED THAT ONE OF THE TRAILER TIRES BLEW OUT.  HE DISCONNECTED THE TRAILER AND LEFT IT AT A GAS STATION.  WHEN HE RETURNED, HE REPLACED THE TIRE AND WHEEL AND TOWED HIS TRAILER TO TC TRAILERS.  THE CONTACT WAS INFORMED THAT THE AXLE WAS INSTALLED UPSIDE DOWN.  TC TRAILERS CONTACTED LARK UNITED MANUFACTURING, INC. AND SHOWED THEM PICTURES OF THE UPSIDE DOWN AXLE.  LARK MANUFACTURING STATED THAT THEY WOULD REPLACE THE TWO TIRES, THE FENDER, AND THE ALUMINUM SIDING THAT HAD BEEN LIFTED OFF THE DRIVER SIDE OF THE TRAILER.  IT HAS BEEN THREE WEEKS SINCE THE MANUFACTURER SPOKE WITH TC TRAILERS AND NO REPAIRS HAVE BEEN MADE.  NO OTHER VEHICLE INFORMATION WAS AVAILABLE.
